post.description: Depending on your use case an Address can be used in many different ways. Certain carriers allow rating between two zip codes, but full addresses are required to purchase postage. It is recommended to provide as much information as possible during creation and to reuse these objects whenever possible.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Address objects are used to represent people, places, and organizations in a number of contexts. For example, a Shipment requires a to_address and from_address to accurately calculate rates and generate postage.

get.description: An Address can be retrieved by either its id or reference. However it is recommended to use EasyPost's provided identifiers because uniqueness on reference is not enforced.
Both production and test keys will be returned a User and all of its children. If the request is authenticated as a Child only the API Keys for that Child will be returned.
Retrieve an unpaginated list of all CarrierAccounts available to the authenticated account. Only Production API keys may be used to retrieve this list, as there is no test mode equivalent.

post.description: CarrierAccount objects may be managed through the EasyPost API using the Production mode API key only. Multiple accounts can be added for a single carrier (with the exception of the USPS).

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: A CarrierAccount encapsulates your credentials with the carrier. The CarrierAccount object provides CRUD operations for all CarrierAccounts.

get.description: Retrieve an unpaginated list of all CarrierAccounts available to the authenticated account. Only Production API keys may be used to retrieve this list, as there is no test mode equivalent.

put.description: Updates can be made to description, reference, and any fields in credentials or test_credentials.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: A CarrierAccount encapsulates your credentials with the carrier. The CarrierAccount object provides CRUD operations for all CarrierAccounts.

delete.description: CarrierAccount objects may be removed from your account when they become out of date or no longer useful.

get.description: The Insurance List is a paginated list of all Insurance objects associated with the given API Key. It accepts a variety of parameters which can be used to modify the scope. The has_more attribute indicates whether or not additional pages can be requested. The recommended way of paginating is to use either the before_id or after_id parameter to specify where the next page begins.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The Insurance List is a paginated list of all Insurance objects associated with the given API Key. It accepts a variety of parameters which can be used to modify the scope. The has_more attribute indicates whether or not additional pages can be requested. The recommended way of paginating is to use either the before_id or after_id parameter to specify where the next page begins.

post.description: An Insurance created via this endpoint must belong to a shipment purchased outside of EasyPost. Insurance for Shipments created within EasyPost must be created via the Shipment Buy or Insure endpoints. When creating Insurance for a non-EasyPost shipment, you must provide to_address, from_address, tracking_code, and amount information. Optionally, you can provide the carrier parameter, which will help EasyPost identify the carrier the package was shipped with. If no carrier is provided, EasyPost will attempt to determine the carrier based on the tracking_code provided. Providing a carrier parameter is recommended, since some tracking_codes are ambiguous and may match with more than one carrier. In addition, not having to auto-match the carrier will significantly speed up the response time.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: An Insurance created via this endpoint must belong to a shipment purchased outside of EasyPost. Insurance for Shipments created within EasyPost must be created via the Shipment Buy or Insure endpoints.

post.description: Include the weight, and either a predefined_package or length, width and height.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Parcel objects represent the physical container being shipped. Dimensions can be supplied either as length, width, and height dimensions, or a predefined_package string. If you provide a carrier specific predefined_package the associated Shipment will only fetch rates from that carrier.

get.description: Get a Parcel by its id. In general you should not need to use this in your automated solution. A Parcel's id can be inlined into the creation call to other objects. This allows you to only create one Parcel for each package you will be using.

post.description: A Shipment is almost exclusively a container for other objects, and thus a Shipment may reuse many of these objects. Additionally, all the objects contained within a Shipment may be created at the same time.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Parcel objects represent the physical container being shipped. Dimensions can be supplied either as length, width, and height dimensions, or a predefined_package string. If you provide a carrier specific predefined_package the associated Shipment will only fetch rates from that carrier.

get.description: Get a Parcel by its id. In general you should not need to use this in your automated solution. A Parcel's id can be inlined into the creation call to other objects. This allows you to only create one Parcel for each package you will be using.

post.description: To purchase a Shipment you only need to specify the Rate to purchase. This operation populates the tracking_code and postage_label attributes. The default image format of the associated PostageLabel is PNG. To change this default see the label_format option.
Insuring your Shipment is as simple as sending us the value of the contents. We charge 1% of the value, with a $1 minimum, and handle all the claims. All our claims are paid out within 30 days.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Insuring your Shipment is as simple as sending us the value of the contents. We charge 1% of the value, with a $1 minimum, and handle all the claims. All our claims are paid out within 30 days.

post.description: A Shipment's PostageLabel can be converted from PNG to other formats. If the PostageLabel was originally generated in a format other than PNG it cannot be converted.
You can update the Rates of a Shipment at any time. This operation respects the carrier_accounts attribute.

Refunding a Shipment is avaliable for many carriers supported by EasyPost. Once the refund has been submitted, refund_status attribute of the Shipment will be populated with one of the possible values: "submitted", "refunded", "rejected". The most common initial status is "submitted". Many carriers require that the refund be processed before the refund_status will move to "refunded". The length of this process depends on the carrier, but no greater than 30 days.

get.description: The Tracker List is a paginated list of all Tracker objects associated with the given API Key. It accepts a variety of parameters which can be used to modify the scope. The has_more attribute indicates whether or not additional pages can be requested. The recommended way of paginating is to use either the before_id or after_id parameter to specify where the next page begins.

post.description: A Tracker can be created with only a tracking_code. Optionally, you can provide the carrier parameter, which indicates the carrier the package was shipped with. If no carrier is provided, EasyPost will attempt to determine the carrier based on the tracking_code provided. Providing a carrier parameter is recommended, since some tracking_codes are ambiguous and may match with more than one carrier. In addition, not having to auto-match the carrier will significantly speed up the response time.

insurance.description: Additionally, insurance may be added during the purchase. To specify an amount to insure, pass the insurance attribute as a string. The currency of all insurance is USD.

CreateAddressPayload.title: CreateAddressPayload

carrier_facility.description: The specific designation for the address (only relevant if the address is a carrier facility)

city.description: City the address is located in

company.description: Name of the organization. Both name and company can be included

country.description: ISO 3166 country code for the country the address is located in

email.description: Email to reach the person or organization

federal_tax_id.description: Federal tax identifier of the person or organization

name.description: Name of the person. Both name and company can be included

phone.description: Phone number to reach the person or organization

residential.description: Whether or not this address would be considered residential

state.description: State or province the address is located in

state_tax_id.description: State tax identifier of the person or organization

verify.description: The verifications to perform when creating. verify_strict takes precedence

verify_strict.description: The verifications to perform when creating. The failure of any of these verifications causes the whole request to fail

zip.description: ZIP or postal code the address is located in

CreateAddressPayload.description: Address objects are used to represent people, places, and organizations in a number of contexts. For example, a Shipment requires a to_address and from_address to accurately calculate rates and generate postage.

CreateCarrierAccountPayload.title: CreateCarrierAccountPayload

clone.description: If clone is true, only the reference and description are possible to update

credentials.description: Unlike the "credentials" object contained in "fields", this nullable object contains just raw credential pairs for client library consumption

description.description: An optional, user-readable field to help distinguish accounts

readable.description: The name used when displaying a readable value for the type of the account

reference.description: An optional field that may be used in place of carrier_account_id in other API endpoints

test_credentials.description: Unlike the "test_credentials" object contained in "fields", this nullable object contains just raw test_credential pairs for client library consumption

type.description: The name of the carrier type. Note that "EndiciaAccount" is the current USPS integration account type

CreateCarrierAccountPayload.description: A CarrierAccount encapsulates your credentials with the carrier. The CarrierAccount object provides CRUD operations for all CarrierAccounts.

description.description: Required, description of item being shipped

hs_tariff_number.description: Harmonized Tariff Schedule, e.g. "6109.10.0012" for Men's T-shirts

value.description: Required, greater than zero, total value (unit value * quantity)

weight.description: Required, greater than zero, total weight (unit weight * quantity)

CreateInsurancePayload.title: CreateInsurancePayload

amount.description: The USD value of contents you would like to insure. Currently the maximum is between $5000 and $10000 depending on insurer

carrier.description: The carrier associated with the tracking_code you provided. The carrier will get auto-detected if none is provided

reference.description: Optional. A unique value that may be used in place of ID when doing Retrieve calls for this insurance

tracking_code.description: The tracking code associated with the non-EasyPost-purchased package you'd like to insure

CreateInsurancePayload.description: An Insurance created via this endpoint must belong to a shipment purchased outside of EasyPost. Insurance for Shipments created within EasyPost must be created via the Shipment Buy or Insure endpoints.

CreateParcelPayload.title: CreateParcelPayload

height.description: Required if predefined_package is empty. float (inches)

length.description: Required if predefined_package is empty. float (inches)

width.description: Required if predefined_package is empty. float (inches)

CreateParcelPayload.description: Parcel objects represent the physical container being shipped. Dimensions can be supplied either as length, width, and height dimensions, or a predefined_package string. If you provide a carrier specific predefined_package the associated Shipment will only fetch rates from that carrier.

is_return.description: Set true to create as a return, discussed in more depth below

usps_zone.description: The USPS zone of the shipment, if purchased with USPS

CreateShipmentPayload.description: Parcel objects represent the physical container being shipped. Dimensions can be supplied either as length, width, and height dimensions, or a predefined_package string. If you provide a carrier specific predefined_package the associated Shipment will only fetch rates from that carrier.

status.description: The current status of the insurance, possible values are "new", "pending", "purchased", "failed", or "cancelled"

tracking_code.description: The tracking code of either the shipment within EasyPost, or provided by you during creation

EasypostInsurance.description: An Insurance object represents insurance for packages purchased both va the EasyPost API as well as shipments purchased through third parties and later registered with EasyPost. An Insurance is created automatically whenever you buy a Shipment through EasyPost and pass insurance options during the Buy call or in a later call to Insure a Shipment. (default view)

additional_handling.description: Setting this option to true, will add an additional handling charge.

address_validation_level.description: Setting this option to "0", will allow the minimum amount of address information to pass the validation check. Only for USPS postage.

alcohol.description: Set this option to true if your shipment contains alcohol. UPS - only supported for US Domestic shipments. FedEx - only supported for US Domestic shipments. Canada Post - Requires adult signature 19 years or older. If you want adult signature 18 years or older, instead use delivery_confirmation: ADULT_SIGNATURE

bill_receiver_account.description: Setting an account number of the receiver who is to receive and buy the postage. UPS - bill_receiver_postal_code is also required
bill_receiver_account.example: Error fuga accusantium explicabo et asperiores.

bill_receiver_postal_code.description: Setting a postal code of the receiver account you want to buy postage. UPS - bill_receiver_account also required

bill_third_party_account.description: Setting an account number of the third party account you want to buy postage. UPS - bill_third_party_country and bill_third_party_postal_code also required
bill_third_party_account.example: Dolore vero adipisci fugiat excepturi nostrum.

bill_third_party_country.description: Setting a country of the third party account you want to buy postage. UPS - bill_third_party_account and bill_third_party_postal_code also required

bill_third_party_postal_code.description: Setting a postal code of the third party account you want to buy postage. UPS - bill_third_party_country and bill_third_party_account also required

by_drone.description: Setting this option to true will indicate to the carrier to prefer delivery by drone, if the carrier supports drone delivery.

carbon_neutral.description: Setting this to true will add a charge to reduce carbon emissions.

cod_amount.description: Adding an amount will have the carrier collect the specified amount from the recipient.

currency.description: Which currency this shipment will show for rates if carrier allows.

delivered_duty_paid.description: Setting this value to false will pass the cost of duties on to the recipient of the package(s).

delivery_confirmation.description: If you want to request a signature, you can pass "ADULT_SIGNATURE" or "SIGNATURE". You may also request "NO_SIGNATURE" to leave the package at the door. All - some options may be limited for international shipments
delivery_confirmation.example: Voluptas non non incidunt tempore optio.

dry_ice.description: Package contents contain dry ice. UPS - Need dry_ice_weight to be set. UPS MailInnovations - Need dry_ice_weight to be set. FedEx - Need dry_ice_weight to be set

dry_ice_medical.description: If the dry ice is for medical use, set this option to true. UPS - Need dry_ice_weight to be set. UPS MailInnovations - Need dry_ice_weight to be set

dry_ice_weight.description: Weight of the dry ice in ounces. UPS - Need dry_ice to be set. UPS MailInnovations - Need dry_ice to be set. FedEx - Need dry_ice to be set

freight_charge.description: Additional cost to be added to the invoice of this shipment. Only applies to UPS currently.

handling_instructions.description: This is to designate special instructions for the carrier like "Do not drop!".

hold_for_pickup.description: Package will wait at carrier facility for pickup.

invoice_number.description: This will print an invoice number on the postage label.
invoice_number.example: Eos consequatur sed rem aspernatur reprehenderit autem.

label_date.description: Set the date that will appear on the postage label. Accepts ISO 8601 formatted string including time zone offset.

label_format.description: Supported label formats include "PNG", "PDF", "ZPL", and "EPL2". "PNG" is the only format that allows for conversion.

machinable.description: Whether or not the parcel can be processed by the carriers equipment.

print_custom_1.description: You can optionally print custom messages on labels. The locations of these fields show up on different spots on the carrier's labels.

print_custom_1_barcode.description: Create a barcode for this custom reference if supported by carrier.

print_custom_1_code.example: Et vel sit cumque architecto omnis.

print_custom_2.description: An additional message on the label. Same restrictions as print_custom_1

print_custom_2_barcode.description: Create a barcode for this custom reference if supported by carrier.

print_custom_3.description: An additional message on the label. Same restrictions as print_custom_1

print_custom_3_barcode.description: Create a barcode for this custom reference if supported by carrier.

saturday_delivery.description: Set this value to true for delivery on Saturday. Can't be combined with Next Day Air. When setting the saturday_delivery option, you will only get rates for services that are eligible for saturday delivery. If no services are available for saturday delivery, then you will not be returned any rates. You may need to create 2 shipments, one with the saturday_delivery option set on one without to get all your eligible rates.

EasypostTracker.description: The Tracker object contains both the current information about the package as well as previous updates. All of the previous updates are stored in the tracking_details array. Each TrackingDetail object contains the status, the message from the carrier, and a TrackingLocation. (default view)

EasypostTrackingdetail.title: Mediatype identifier: application/easypost.trackingdetail+json

datetime.description: The timestamp when the tracking scan occurred

message.example: Similique quas sed sequi adipisci minima maxime.

source.description: The original source of the information for this scan event, usually the carrier

status.description: The current status of the package, possible values are "unknown", "pre_transit", "in_transit", "out_for_delivery", "delivered", "available_for_pickup", "return_to_sender", "failure", "cancelled" or "error"

EasypostTrackingdetail.description: Each TrackingDetail object contains the status, the message from the carrier, and a TrackingLocation. (default view)

EasypostTrackinglocation.title: Mediatype identifier: application/easypost.trackinglocation+json

city.description: The city where the scan event occurred (if available)

country.description: The country where the scan event occurred (if available)
country.example: Repudiandae vero voluptatem praesentium aut consequatur.

state.description: The state where the scan event occurred (if available)

zip.description: The postal code where the scan event occurred (if available)
zip.example: Beatae dolores et odio aliquam omnis illo.

EasypostTrackinglocation.description: The TrackingLocation contains city, state, country, and zip information about the location where the package was scanned. The information each carrier provides is different, so some carriers may not make use of all of these fields. (default view)

EasypostUser.title: Mediatype identifier: application/easypost.user+json

balance.example: Nisi et iusto rerum voluptas tempore corrupti.

email.example: Quod exercitationem tempora sunt aperiam et aut.

parent_id.description: The ID of the parent user object. Top-level users are defined as users with no parent
parent_id.example: Voluptas optio velit aut eum est.

phone_number.example: Consequatur quas praesentium voluptatum non facere aut.

recharge_amount.description: USD formatted dollars and cents, delimited by a decimal point

recharge_threshold.description: Number of cents USD that when your balance drops below, we automatically recharge your account with your primary payment method.
recharge_threshold.example: Possimus sed aut et cum officia.

secondary_recharge_amount.description: USD formatted dollars and cents, delimited by a decimal point
secondary_recharge_amount.example: Voluptatem omnis sed quod deserunt perferendis tempora.

EasypostUser.description: An Insurance object represents insurance for packages purchased both va the EasyPost API as well as shipments purchased through third parties and later registered with EasyPost. An Insurance is created automatically whenever you buy a Shipment through EasyPost and pass insurance options during the Buy call or in a later call to Insure a Shipment. (default view)

EasypostUserCollection.title: Mediatype identifier: application/easypost.user+json; type=collection
EasypostUserCollection.description: EasypostUserCollection is the media type for an array of EasypostUser (default view)

FieldsObjectPayload.title: FieldsObjectPayload

auto_link.description: For USPS this designates that no credentials are required.

credentials.description: Credentials used in the production environment.

custom_workflow.description: When present, a seperate authentication process will be required through the UI to link this account type.

test_credentials.description: Credentials used in the test environment.

FieldsObjectPayload.description: Contains "credentials" and/or "test_credentials", or may be empty

InsureShipmentPayload.title: InsureShipmentPayload
InsureShipmentPayload.description: Insuring your Shipment is as simple as sending us the value of the contents. We charge 1% of the value, with a $1 minimum, and handle all the claims. All our claims are paid out within 30 days.

ListInsurancePayload.title: ListInsurancePayload

end_datetime.description: Only return records created before this timestamp. Defaults to end of the current day, or 1 month after a passed start_datetime

page_size.description: The number of records to return on each page. The maximum value is 100, and default is 20.

start_datetime.description: Only return records created after this timestamp. Defaults to 1 month ago, or 1 month before a passed end_datetime

ListInsurancePayload.description: The Insurance List is a paginated list of all Insurance objects associated with the given API Key. It accepts a variety of parameters which can be used to modify the scope. The has_more attribute indicates whether or not additional pages can be requested. The recommended way of paginating is to use either the before_id or after_id parameter to specify where the next page begins.

after_id.description: Optional pagination parameter. Only trackers created after the given ID will be included. May not be used with before_id

before_id.description: Optional pagination parameter. Only trackers created before the given ID will be included. May not be used with after_id

carrier.description: Only returns Trackers with the given carrier value

end_datetime.description: Only return Trackers created before this timestamp. Defaults to end of the current day, or 1 month after a passed start_datetime

page_size.description: The number of Trackers to return on each page. The maximum value is 100

start_datetime.description: Only return Trackers created after this timestamp. Defaults to 1 month ago, or 1 month before a passed end_datetime

tracking_code.description: Only returns Trackers with the given tracking_code. Useful for retrieving an individual Tracker by tracking_code rather than by ID

Message.title: Mediatype identifier: message

carrier.description: the name of the carrier generating the error, e.g. "UPS"

message.description: the string from the carrier explaining the problem.

type.description: the category of error that occurred. Most frequently "rate_error"
type.example: Aut voluptatem rerum ipsum eum molestiae et.

Message.description: When rating a Shipment or Pickup, some carriers may fail to generate rates. These failures are returned as part of the Shipment or Pickup as part of their messages attribute, and follow a common object structure. (default view)

UpdateCarrierAccountPayload.title: UpdateCarrierAccountPayload

clone.description: If clone is true, only the reference and description are possible to update

credentials.description: Unlike the "credentials" object contained in "fields", this nullable object contains just raw credential pairs for client library consumption

description.description: An optional, user-readable field to help distinguish accounts

readable.description: The name used when displaying a readable value for the type of the account

reference.description: An optional field that may be used in place of carrier_account_id in other API endpoints

test_credentials.description: Unlike the "test_credentials" object contained in "fields", this nullable object contains just raw test_credential pairs for client library consumption

type.description: The name of the carrier type. Note that "EndiciaAccount" is the current USPS integration account type

UpdateCarrierAccountPayload.description: A CarrierAccount encapsulates your credentials with the carrier. The CarrierAccount object provides CRUD operations for all CarrierAccounts.

field.description: Field of the request that the error describes
field.example: Corrupti similique quo id omnis fugit.

message.description: Human readable description of the problem
